title: Error training on custom dataset with single class
body:
Hi, thanks for sharing your code. When I try to train the network on a dataset with a single class, I encounter the following error:

`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 265, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 152, in train
    loss = model(imgs.to(device), targets, batch_report=report, var=var)
  File "/localhome/c-fpizzati/anaconda3/envs/yolo/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 489, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/falstaff/imaged5/algo2/FP/yolov3/models.py", line 297, in forward
    x, *losses = module[0](x, targets, batch_report, var)
  File "/localhome/c-fpizzati/anaconda3/envs/yolo/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 489, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/falstaff/imaged5/algo2/FP/yolov3/models.py", line 193, in forward
    build_targets(p_boxes, p_conf, p_cls, targets, self.anchor_wh, self.nA, self.nC, nG, batch_report)
  File "/falstaff/imaged5/algo2/FP/yolov3/utils/utils.py", line 278, in build_targets
    tcls[b, a, gj, gi, tc] = 1
RuntimeError: index 1 is out of bounds for dim with size 1
`
I followed all the advices reported in a previous comment, so I modified the network structure (18 filters in the layers before yolo), the config file, and the data.names file. Do you know why it fails?
